rrhvella.coursework1

Class MelodyGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • rrhvella.coursework1.ContextSensitiveNonDeterministicLSystem
      • rrhvella.coursework1.MelodyGenerator

  • public class MelodyGenerator
extends ContextSensitiveNonDeterministicLSystem
    Generates a melody using a context-sensitive stochastic L-system.

    • Method Detail

      • getAxiom

        private static java.lang.String getAxiom(int length)
        Returns the axiom needed to generate a melody of the given length. According to the specification for this grammar, the notes are initially very long, and the productions will then subdivide them into smaller ones (Worth & Stepney, 2005a, p. 5). In this application, the initial long notes occupy a single bar. Therefore, the axiom returned should be a number of consecutive Fs equal to the length. For example, a length of 3 will give "FFF" and a length of 6 will give "FFFFFF".
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the melody, in bars.
        Returns:
        the axiom to generate a melody of the given length.

      • process

        public java.lang.String process(java.lang.String source)
        Process the given string according to the rewriting the rules of this grammar and return the result.
        Overrides:
        process in class ContextSensitiveNonDeterministicLSystem
        Parameters:
        source - the string which will be rewritten.
        Returns:
        the result of the rewriting process.

      • valid

        private boolean valid(java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        Returns true if the given string is valid. A string is valid if and only if, during rendering no attempt is made to divide a note equal to 1 PPQ. If such an attempt is made during the actual rendering process, an error would be caused.
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - the string which will be validated.
        Returns:
        true if the given string is valid.

      • getMelodyProductions

        private static java.util.HashMap<ContextSensitiveNonDeterministicPredecessor,java.lang.String> getMelodyProductions()
        Returns the productions of the melody generator. The productions are a direct translations of the ones used by Worth and Stepney for their 'Random Branching' grammar (2005b, "Random branching").
        Returns:
        the productions of the melody generator.
